comments.body:
`conda install python=3.6` prevents building a wheel for pandas:

#### Without `conda install python=3.6`

```shell
% cat Dockerfile
FROM continuumio/miniconda3:4.6.14
RUN python --version
RUN pip install pandas

% docker build .

Step 1/3 : FROM continuumio/miniconda3:4.6.14
 ---> 6b5cf97566c3
Step 2/3 : RUN python --version
 ---> Running in 0c244b73788d
Python 3.7.3
Step 3/3 : RUN pip install pandas
 ---> Running in 7ca3e306e486
Collecting pandas
  Downloading https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/12/01/360d7f444f910ae16496c07e3f003cb8c641b4ca6c033408a4469a904df3/pandas-1.3.1.tar.gz (4.7MB)
  Installing build dependencies: started
  ...                                                                                                                                                                       
  # pandas-1.3.1.tar.gz (not wheel) is downloaded. This means there is no wheel that's compatible with the current python version and operating system.
```

#### With `conda install python=3.6`

```shell
% cat Dockerfile
FROM continuumio/miniconda3:4.6.14
RUN conda install python=3.6
RUN python --version
RUN pip install pandas

% docker build .
Step 1/4 : FROM continuumio/miniconda3:4.6.14
 ---> 6b5cf97566c3
Step 2/4 : RUN conda install python=3.6
 ---> Running in f07b2725e9e9
Step 3/4 : RUN python --version
 ---> Running in bdf10ee752cf
Python 3.6.13 :: Anaconda, Inc.
Removing intermediate container bdf10ee752cf
 ---> 8a14681c8b41
Step 4/4 : RUN pip install pandas
 ---> Running in 5bbe6d11435e
Collecting pandas
  Downloading pandas-1.1.5-cp36-cp36m-manylinux1_x86_64.whl (9.5 MB)
  ...
   
  # wheel is downloaded
```
